raw_data.official_title: Phase II Study of 852A Administered Subcutaneously in Patients With Metastatic Refractory Breast, Ovarian, Endometrial and Cervical Cancers

criteria.raw_text:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adequate performance status:

  * Breast - Karnofsky score \> 50;
  * Ovarian, endometrial or cervical - Gynecologic Oncology Group (GOG) performance score ≤2
* If female and of childbearing potential, are willing to use adequate contraception (hormonal, barrier method, abstinence) prior to study entry and for the duration of study participation.
* Normal organ function within 14 days of study entry
* Diagnosis of one of the following malignancies:

  * Metastatic breast cancer (BR)
  * Metastatic ovarian cancer (OV)
  * Metastatic endometrial cancer (EM)
  * Metastatic cervical cancer (CX)

Breast Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease (\>1cm) in at least one site other than bone-only
* Progression on or failure to respond to at least one previous chemotherapy regimen for metastatic disease
* Progression on prior therapy with a hormonal agent if estrogen receptor or progesterone receptor positive, and/or with trastuzumab if HER2-neu positive. If patient has progressed through hormone or trastuzumab therapy only, must have received one chemotherapy regimen.

Ovarian Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
* Primary tumor must have been diagnosed histologically as either epithelial ovarian cancer, fallopian tube cancer, or primary peritoneal cancer (not borderline or low malignant potential epithelial carcinoma).
* Subjects must have failed at least two previous chemotherapy regimens. Paclitaxel must have been a component of one or both regimens and cisplatin or carboplatin must have been a component of one or both regimens.

Endometrial Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease
* Histologically proven recurrent or persistent endometrial cancer that is not amenable to curative treatment with surgery and/or radiation therapy AND has failed 2 previous treatment regimens

Cervical Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease
* Histologically proven recurrent or persistent squamous cell carcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, or adenocarcinoma of the cervix that is not amenable to curative treatment with surgery and/or radiation therapy AND has failed 2 previous treatment regimens.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Had/have the following prior/concurrent therapy:

  * Systemic corticosteroids (oral or injectable) within 7 days of first dose of 852A (topical or inhaled steroids are allowed)
  * Investigational drugs/agents within 14 days of first dose of 852A
  * Immunosuppressive therapy, including cytotoxic agents within 14 days of first dose of 852A (nitrosoureas within 30 days of first dose)
  * Drugs known to induce QT interval prolongation and/or induce Torsades de pointes unless best available drug required to treat life-threatening conditions
  * Radiotherapy within 3 weeks of the first dose of 852A
  * Hematopoietic cell transplantation within 4 weeks of first dose of 852A
  * Evidence of active infection within 3 days of first dose of 852A
  * Active fungal infection or pulmonary infiltrates (prior treated disease stable for 2 weeks is allowable)
  * Cardiac ischemia, cardiac arrhythmias or congestive heart failure uncontrolled by medication
  * History of, or clinical evidence of, a condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, could confound the results of the study or put the subject at undue risk
  * Uncontrolled intercurrent or chronic illness
  * Active autoimmune disease requiring immunosuppressive therapy within 30 days
  * Active coagulation disorder not controlled with medication
  * Pregnant or lactating
  * Concurrent malignancy (if in remission, at least 5 years disease free) except for localized (in-situ) disease, basal carcinomas and cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas that have been adequately treated
  * Any history of brain metastases or any other active central nervous system (CNS) disease

structurized.raw_text:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adequate performance status:

  * Breast - Karnofsky score > 50;
  * Ovarian, endometrial or cervical - Gynecologic Oncology Group (GOG) performance score ≤2
* If female and of childbearing potential, are willing to use adequate contraception (hormonal, barrier method, abstinence) prior to study entry and for the duration of study participation.
* Normal organ function within 14 days of study entry
* Diagnosis of one of the following malignancies:

  * Metastatic breast cancer (BR)
  * Metastatic ovarian cancer (OV)
  * Metastatic endometrial cancer (EM)
  * Metastatic cervical cancer (CX)

Breast Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease (>1cm) in at least one site other than bone-only
* Progression on or failure to respond to at least one previous chemotherapy regimen for metastatic disease
* Progression on prior therapy with a hormonal agent if estrogen receptor or progesterone receptor positive, and/or with trastuzumab if HER2-neu positive. If patient has progressed through hormone or trastuzumab therapy only, must have received one chemotherapy regimen.

Ovarian Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
* Primary tumor must have been diagnosed histologically as either epithelial ovarian cancer, fallopian tube cancer, or primary peritoneal cancer (not borderline or low malignant potential epithelial carcinoma).
* Subjects must have failed at least two previous chemotherapy regimens. Paclitaxel must have been a component of one or both regimens and cisplatin or carboplatin must have been a component of one or both regimens.

Endometrial Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease
* Histologically proven recurrent or persistent endometrial cancer that is not amenable to curative treatment with surgery and/or radiation therapy AND has failed 2 previous treatment regimens

Cervical Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease
* Histologically proven recurrent or persistent squamous cell carcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, or adenocarcinoma of the cervix that is not amenable to curative treatment with surgery and/or radiation therapy AND has failed 2 previous treatment regimens.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Had/have the following prior/concurrent therapy:

  * Systemic corticosteroids (oral or injectable) within 7 days of first dose of 852A (topical or inhaled steroids are allowed)
  * Investigational drugs/agents within 14 days of first dose of 852A
  * Immunosuppressive therapy, including cytotoxic agents within 14 days of first dose of 852A (nitrosoureas within 30 days of first dose)
  * Drugs known to induce QT interval prolongation and/or induce Torsades de pointes unless best available drug required to treat life-threatening conditions
  * Radiotherapy within 3 weeks of the first dose of 852A
  * Hematopoietic cell transplantation within 4 weeks of first dose of 852A
  * Evidence of active infection within 3 days of first dose of 852A
  * Active fungal infection or pulmonary infiltrates (prior treated disease stable for 2 weeks is allowable)
  * Cardiac ischemia, cardiac arrhythmias or congestive heart failure uncontrolled by medication
  * History of, or clinical evidence of, a condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, could confound the results of the study or put the subject at undue risk
  * Uncontrolled intercurrent or chronic illness
  * Active autoimmune disease requiring immunosuppressive therapy within 30 days
  * Active coagulation disorder not controlled with medication
  * Pregnant or lactating
  * Concurrent malignancy (if in remission, at least 5 years disease free) except for localized (in-situ) disease, basal carcinomas and cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas that have been adequately treated
  * Any history of brain metastases or any other active central nervous system (CNS) disease
structurized.category: compound_Criterion- when there are two or more criterions which can be seperated into various questions
structurized.category_reasoning: The criterion includes multiple inclusion and exclusion criteria that are logically connected and can be separated into distinct questions. It involves hierarchical criteria for different cancer types and specific conditions for inclusion and exclusion.
structurized.overall_thoughts: The criterion is well-structured, covering a comprehensive set of inclusion and exclusion criteria for a clinical trial involving multiple cancer types. It specifies performance status, organ function, and specific cancer diagnoses for inclusion, as well as detailed exclusion criteria related to prior therapies and health conditions.

criterions.raw_text:
Ovarian Cancer Inclusion Criteria:

* Measurable metastatic disease as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
* Primary tumor must have been diagnosed histologically as either epithelial ovarian cancer, fallopian tube cancer, or primary peritoneal cancer (not borderline or low malignant potential epithelial carcinoma).
* Subjects must have failed at least two previous chemotherapy regimens. Paclitaxel must have been a component of one or both regimens and cisplatin or carboplatin must have been a component of one or both regimens.
criterions.category: compound_Criterion- when there are two or more criterions which can be seperated into various questions
criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion is composed of multiple distinct requirements that need to be met for inclusion, each of which can be considered separately.
criterions.overall_thoughts: This is a well-structured compound criterion for a clinical trial, specifying multiple inclusion requirements for participants with ovarian cancer.

criterions.raw_text: Measurable metastatic disease as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
criterions.category: atomic_Criterion- where there is only one criterion that can be answered with a simple question
criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion specifies a single condition that can be verified: the presence of measurable metastatic disease according to RECIST guidelines.
criterions.overall_thoughts: This criterion is straightforward as it refers to a specific and standardized method of evaluating metastatic disease, which is commonly used in clinical trials.
qualifiers: as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
additional_information: RECIST is a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ('respond'), stay the same ('stabilize'), or worsen ('progress') during treatments.

criterions.raw_text: Primary tumor must have been diagnosed histologically as either epithelial ovarian cancer, fallopian tube cancer, or primary peritoneal cancer (not borderline or low malignant potential epithelial carcinoma).

additional_information: Excludes borderline or low malignant potential epithelial carcinoma

criterions.raw_text: Subjects must have failed at least two previous chemotherapy regimens. Paclitaxel must have been a component of one or both regimens and cisplatin or carboplatin must have been a component of one or both regimens.

criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion is compound because it involves multiple conditions that need to be satisfied: failing two chemotherapy regimens, having paclitaxel in one or both regimens, and having cisplatin or carboplatin in one or both regimens.
criterions.overall_thoughts: The criterion is clear and specifies multiple conditions that must be met regarding previous chemotherapy treatments, making it a compound criterion.

criterions.raw_text: Subjects must have failed at least two previous chemotherapy regimens.

criterions.overall_thoughts: The criterion specifies that either cisplatin or carboplatin must be included in the treatment regimens, indicating flexibility in the treatment components. This is a clear compound criterion due to the presence of two distinct options connected by 'OR'.

criterions.raw_text: Carboplatin must have been a component of one or both regimens.

criterions.raw_text: Measurable metastatic disease AND Histologically proven recurrent or persistent endometrial cancer that is not amenable to curative treatment with surgery and/or radiation therapy AND has failed 2 previous treatment regimens

criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion is composed of two separate conditions that need to be met: having measurable metastatic disease and having a specific type of endometrial cancer that meets additional conditions. These are joined by an AND operator, indicating that both conditions must be satisfied.
criterions.overall_thoughts: The criterion is clearly a compound criterion as it involves multiple conditions that need to be satisfied for inclusion in the trial. The use of 'AND' indicates that all listed conditions must be met.

criterions.category: atomic_Criterion- where there is only one criterion that can be answered with a simple question

criterions.raw_text:
Exclusion Criteria:

* Had/have the following prior/concurrent therapy:

  * Systemic corticosteroids (oral or injectable) within 7 days of first dose of 852A (topical or inhaled steroids are allowed)
  * Investigational drugs/agents within 14 days of first dose of 852A
  * Immunosuppressive therapy, including cytotoxic agents within 14 days of first dose of 852A (nitrosoureas within 30 days of first dose)
  * Drugs known to induce QT interval prolongation and/or induce Torsades de pointes unless best available drug required to treat life-threatening conditions
  * Radiotherapy within 3 weeks of the first dose of 852A
  * Hematopoietic cell transplantation within 4 weeks of first dose of 852A
  * Evidence of active infection within 3 days of first dose of 852A
  * Active fungal infection or pulmonary infiltrates (prior treated disease stable for 2 weeks is allowable)
  * Cardiac ischemia, cardiac arrhythmias or congestive heart failure uncontrolled by medication
  * History of, or clinical evidence of, a condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, could confound the results of the study or put the subject at undue risk
  * Uncontrolled intercurrent or chronic illness
  * Active autoimmune disease requiring immunosuppressive therapy within 30 days
  * Active coagulation disorder not controlled with medication
  * Pregnant or lactating
  * Concurrent malignancy (if in remission, at least 5 years disease free) except for localized (in-situ) disease, basal carcinomas and cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas that have been adequately treated
  * Any history of brain metastases or any other active central nervous system (CNS) disease
criterions.category: compound_Criterion- when there are two or more criterions which can be seperated into various questions
criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion lists multiple exclusion conditions that are distinct and can be separated into individual questions regarding prior/concurrent therapies, medical conditions, and other health-related factors.
criterions.overall_thoughts: This exclusion criterion is comprehensive, covering a wide range of prior treatments and medical conditions that could impact the study's outcomes or participant safety. Each bullet point represents a separate exclusion condition.

criterions.overall_thoughts: The criterion is clear in specifying the exclusion of systemic corticosteroids within a certain timeframe, while allowing topical or inhaled steroids.
qualifiers: within 7 days of first dose of 852A
additional_information: topical or inhaled steroids are allowed

criterions.raw_text: Drugs known to induce QT interval prolongation and/or induce Torsades de pointes unless best available drug required to treat life-threatening conditions
criterions.category: hierarchical_criterion- when there is a parent criterion and a child criterion which adds further criteria should the parent be true.
criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion specifies a condition related to the use of certain drugs (those that induce QT interval prolongation or Torsades de pointes) and adds an exception (unless the drug is required to treat life-threatening conditions). This structure indicates a hierarchical relationship where the child criterion modifies the parent criterion.
criterions.overall_thoughts: This criterion is concerned with the safety of drug use in the context of clinical trials, specifically focusing on the risk of QT interval prolongation and Torsades de pointes. The exception clause allows for flexibility in cases where the drug is necessary for treating life-threatening conditions, highlighting a balance between risk and necessity.

qualifiers: known to induce QT interval prolongation
additional_information: QT interval prolongation is a measure of delayed ventricular repolarization, which can lead to arrhythmias.
Torsades de pointes is a specific type of abnormal heart rhythm that can be life-threatening.
QT interval prolongation and Torsades de pointes are serious cardiac conditions that can be induced by certain medications.
The criterion allows for exceptions when the drug is necessary for treating life-threatening conditions, indicating a risk-benefit assessment.
